47.title:  Kid Liberty. Captain Stupendous
47.author: by Zach Weiner ; artist, Chris Jones.
notes: Originally published as the webcomic "Captain Excelsior."

"Captain Stupendous is having a bad life. His ex-wife, Mrs. Mind, is marrying a mortal. His eldest son, Kid Liberty, is struggling with his sexual identity. His daughter, Tesla Curl, can't get a date to the prom. And, his mortal middle child, what's-his-name, is, well, mortal."

99.title:  Kid Montana
99.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Kid Montana (also called just "Gunfighter" in the story, finds a hidden jungle valley in the Colorado Rockies, peopled by a tribe of Ute Indians whose ruler is a princess in a short haircut and a nice dress. The Kid must pass three tests to win his freedom, one against a poison snake, one against a swamp full of crocodiles, and one in a lake of fire.

contents.title: Miscellanea. "Safari : Y'a pas Photo!"

notes: Describes the small-format comic book that published 169 issues from 1967 to 1987. Includes a biographical sketch of Claudio Tinoco (1920-) and descriptions of the major features in the magazine: Katanga Joe, Oncle Arthur, Johnny Speed, Klip et Klop, Bull Rocket, Jungle Jack, Teddy, Kid Pharaon, Le Cyclope, Flash Spécial, Tiki Fils de la Jungle, Simba le Fils du Fleuve, & Delta 99, with a list of minor features. Includes issue numbers and credits for the features.

Based on the motion picture featuring Michael Jordan and Warner Bros. cartoon characters.

132.title:  Kid-Rid Corporation. Sound Off!
132.author: by D
132.appears_in: J. Steinberg ; illustrated by Brian Smith.
notes: (The Adventures of Daniel Boom (aka Loud Boy) ; 1)

Summary (from Amazon.com via SkyRiver): Being the new kid in town with no volume control on his voice, Daniel Boom discovers an even bigger problem: the evil Kid-Rid Corporation has silenced the entire world with their terrible Soundsucker LX machine! Daniel taps into his inner superhero to become Loud Boy, along with his new pals who have bad habits (aka superpowers) of their own. The unlikely heroes are able to turn the tables on the villains, restoring peace and un-quiet to the world once more! But is it the end of Kid-Rid?

133.title:  Kid-Rid Industries. Mac Attack!
133.author: written by D
133.appears_in: J. Steinberg ; illustrated by Brian Smith.
notes: (The Adventures of Daniel Boom (aka Loud Boy) ; 2)

Summary (from SkyRiver): Loud Boy and his friends call upon their superpowers, which consist mainly of atrocious behavior, to confront the cafeteria lady, who is working with the evil Kid-Rid Industries to brainwash children into being polite.

157.appears_in: Torres ; illustrated by Mike Norton ; lettered by Nate Piekos @ Blambot ; designed by Keith Wood ; edited by James Lucas Jones.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Jason's dreams of having a mechanized friend are about to come true, or at least that's what he thinks when he finds a giant cybernetic hand sticking out of a crevasse near his desert home. What will his inventor grandfather and stubborn kid sister think of his ultimate toy? And what other trouble will the earthquakes that unearthed the giant machine man cause?

169.title:  Kid Slade, Gunfighter
169.author: art, Werner Roth

notes: Other assigned title: "New Future for Ace and Lily"*
Dialogue begins: "Hold it, Jesse! He ain't no Injun!"
Beginning caption: "Gold turns men to animals, particularly on a raw frontier where law rests in a man's holsters."
Data from Ethan Hoddes, Tony R. Rose, Lou Mougin, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

170.title:  Kid Slade, Gunfighter
170.author: art, Werner Roth
170.appears_in: 5 p. in Kid Slade, Gunfighter, no. 5 (Jan. 1957) ; reprinted in Mighty Marvel Western, no. 31 (May 1974) as a Matt Slade story.
notes: Begins: "Give me a chance, Slade! Set me free! If they get me they'll kill me, 'cause I can't tell them what they want to know."

197.appears_in: 13 p. in Kid Colt Outlaw, no. 130 (Sept. 1966) ; reprinted from Kid Colt Outlaw, no. 95 (Dec. 1960) ; reprinted again in Kid Colt Outlaw, no. 182 (May 1974).

In two chapters: 1. "The Kid Turns Bad" ; 2. "The Unholy Alliance."
Data from Nick Caputo, Banks S. Robinson, Darrel McCann, et al., via Grand Comics Database.

208.title:  "The Kid Who Struck Out Superman!"
208.author: script, Leo Dorfman ; pencils, Curt Swan ; inks, George Roussos ; letters, Joe Letterese
notes: Summary: Superman tries out several professional sports (baseball, basketball, boxing, football, soccer, & tennis) but dismisses them all as boring and unchallenging. It's all a ruse to cover his plan to prevent the alien Slurrans from invading Earth.
Data from Gene Reed, and from Tony R. Rose, Mark Waid, Nick Caputo, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

209.author: script, Dave Wood ; art, Pete Costanza
209.appears_in: 9 p. in Superman's Pal, Jimmy Olsen, no. 115 (Oct. 1968).
notes: Summary: Duncan Brite has a plan to discover Superman's real identity.
Data from Bill Wormstedt, Allen Ross, Mike Nielsen, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

210.title:  "The Kid Who Was King of Crooks"

notes: Summary: Two criminals 'rescue' Gar (Beast Boy) Logan from the jungle, and use him to commit their crimes.
Data from Mike Tiefenbacher and from Jan Roar Hansen, Jim Van Dore, Dwayne Best, et al. via Grand Comics Database.
